result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Wilcox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: to any probation currently on in Minnesota

miscConds.notes: Comply with the sex offender reporting requirement.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:00Defendant Joseph  Wilcox in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thoie - Amended information is filed with the court. Amend charge to obstructing an officer S/W Probation 1 year.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the amended charge.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the amended charge. Court orders S/W Probation 1 year concurrent to any probation on in Minnesota.  Cond.  Comply with the sex offender reporting requirement.  Court Costs. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Thorie addresses change of offense date.  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court  The bond will continue as ordered.

3:40 p.m. Defendant Joseph Wilcox in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph Wilcox in courtvia video conf from PCJ  with attorney Liesl E. Nelson who appears by telephone.  Defendant Joseph Wilcox in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights . Defendant waives the time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Def was a member of the military  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
